raw_text: Some work has touched on shared knowledge of lexical semantics [aacobs, 1985, Steinacker and Buchberger, 19831 and on grammatical frameworks uitable for bidirectional systems [Kay, 1984]
clean_text: Some work has touched on shared knowledge of lexical semantics [aacobs, 1985, Steinacker and Buchberger, 19831 and on grammatical framework suitable for bidirectional systems [Kay, 1984].

raw_text: As mentioned, FCGorganises the information about an utterance in feature structures, similar to other feature-structure based formalisms (as first introduced by Kay (Kay, 1984)) but with some important differences
clean_text: As mentioned, FCG organises the information about an utterance in feature structures, similar to other feature-structure based formalisms (as first introduced by Kay (Kay, 1984)) but with some important differences.

raw_text: The family of grammar models that are based on such formalisms include Generalized Phrase Structure Grammar (GPSG) [Gazdar et al 1985], Lexical Functional Grammar (LFG) [Bresnan 1982], Functional Unification Grammar (bUG) [Kay 1984], Head-Driven Phrase Structure Grammar (I-IPSG) [Pollard and Sag 1988], and Categorial Unification Grammar (CUG) [Karttunen 1986, Uszkoreit 1986, Zeevat et al 1987]
clean_text: The family of grammar models that are based on such formalisms include Generalized Phrase Structure Grammar (GPSG) [Gazdar et al 1985], Lexical Functional Grammar (LFG) [Bresnan 1982], Functional Unification Grammar (bUG) [Kay 1984], Head-Driven Phrase Structure Grammar (I-IPSG) [Pollard and Sag 1988], and Categorial Unification Grammar (CUG) [Karttunen 1986, Uszkoreit 1986, Zeevat et al 1987].

raw_text: Figure 3: One of the grammar alternatives for a unit The text planner is implemented as a Functional Unification Grammar (Kay 1984) in FUF (Elhadad 1993)
clean_text: The text planner is implemented as a Functional Unification Grammar (Kay 1984) in FUF (Elhadad 1993).
